definition: sheep's head/fig. advertisement for good meat
head/hair style/the top/end/beginning or end/a stub/remnant/chief/boss/side/aspect/first/leading/classifier for pigs or livestock/CL:個|个[ge4]
lit. to hang a sheep's head while selling dog meat (idiom)/fig. to cheat/dishonest advertising/wicked deeds carried out under banner of virtue
pinyin: gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

definition: see 掛羊頭賣狗肉|挂羊头卖狗肉[gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4]
see 掛羊頭賣狗肉|挂羊头卖狗肉[gua4 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4]
pinyin: xuan2 yang2 tou2 mai4 gou3 rou4

sentences.english: Furthermore, the cheat who advertises lamb but sells dog meat poisons his customers.
sentences.chinese: 更有甚者，挂羊头卖狗肉，毒也。

sentences.english: They hang a sheep's head in their drawing room, it is said to avoid evil spirits.
sentences.chinese: 她们家客厅挂了一个羊头，听说可以避邪。

sentences.english: They display the sheep's head of constitutional government while selling the dog-meat of one-party dictatorship.
sentences.chinese: 他们是在挂宪政的羊头，卖一党专政的狗肉。

sentences.english: Yes, you could do some trickery here with .
sentences.chinese: 的是的，你可以在这里做一些挂羊头卖狗肉与。

sentences.english: To sell horse meat as beefsteak is their usual practice.
sentences.chinese: 挂羊头卖狗肉是他们的惯技。

sentences.english: This restaurant, that movie palace, his favorite fishing boat in Sheepshead Bay.
sentences.chinese: 这家餐厅，那家电影院，还有羊头湾他那最爱的渔船。

definition: variant of 榔頭|榔头[lang2 tou5]
Ox-Head, one of the two guardians of the underworld in Chinese mythology
(fig.) attractive and easy mark/source of steady profit/moneymaker/cash cow
fish head/fig. upright and unwilling to compromise
